intro: Carex brizoides proles clavaudiana, commonly known as the Clavaud's sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered spikelets. Native to specific regions in Europe, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant produces wind-pollinated flowers, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity. Its growth habit and habitat preferences make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
